original: Your dreams might show you all kinds of insights into things that you didn't realise you were thinking about. Common dreams like being able to fly or falling, your teeth falling out or having no clothes on in a public place probably mean something similar in most people. But the key to understanding exactly what they mean to you is to connect them to the events and feelings in your daily life.
simplified:
Your dreams can show you things. You did not know you thought about them.
Some dreams are common. For example, you can fly. Or you fall. Your teeth fall out. Or you have no clothes in a public place. These dreams mean the same for many people.
But you need to know what your dreams mean for you. Link them to your life every day. And link them to how you feel.

original: Your dreams might show you all kinds of insights into things that you didn't realise you were thinking about. simplified: Your dreams might show you different ideas about things you didn't know you were thinking about. For example, common dreams like being able to fly or falling, or your teeth falling out, or having no clothes on in a public place, probably mean something similar for most people. However, the best way to understand what these dreams truly mean for you is to connect them to the things that happen and how you feel in your daily life.

original: One of the most interesting cases of wild animals living in a city are the wild dogs of Moscow. In Moscow, there are approximately 35,000 wild dogs living on the streets. Some of the dogs were born wild, while others are pets that have been abandoned by their owners. Some dogs live alone and others live in packs. In 2010, scientists studied the dogs and found that the dogs have adapted remarkably successfully to urban life. They have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people and some dogs appear to understand traffic lights.
simplified:
Wild dogs live in Moscow. This is interesting.
About 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets there.
Some dogs were born wild.
Other dogs were pets. Their owners left them.
Some dogs live alone. Other dogs live in groups.
In 2010, scientists studied the dogs.
They saw the dogs learned to live in the city very well. This was a big success.
The dogs learned it is safer to cross the street with people.
Some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

original: One of the most interesting cases of wild animals living in a city are the wild dogs of Moscow. In Moscow, there are approximately 35,000 wild dogs living on the streets. Some of the dogs were born wild, while others are pets that have been abandoned by their owners. Some dogs live alone and others live in packs. In 2010, scientists studied the dogs and found that the dogs have adapted remarkably successfully to urban life. They have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people and some dogs appear to understand traffic lights.
simplified: The wild dogs of Moscow are one of the most interesting examples of wild animals that live in a city, where there are about 35,000 of them living on the streets. Some of these dogs were born wild, while others were pets that their owners left, and they live alone or in packs. In 2010, scientists studied the dogs and found that they have adapted very well to city life. For example, they have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people, and some dogs even seem to understand traffic lights.

original: Wonder is New Yorker RJ Palacio's first novel. On her website, she explains that the idea for the book came to her after seeing a girl with facial deformities on the street one day. Wonder has been a bestseller in the United States and has already won several awards. Many schools are using it as a starting point for discussions about bullying, friendship and what it's like to be different. A film version is being made, and many, including me, are waiting eagerly to see what RJ Palacio writes next.
simplified:
RJ Palacio wrote her first book. Its name is Wonder.
One day, she saw a girl. The girl had a different face. This gave RJ Palacio the idea for her book. She writes this on her website.
Many people bought Wonder in the USA. It won many awards.
Many schools use this book. They talk about bad things people do. They talk about being friends. They talk about being different.
Now, a film of the book is coming. Many people want to see it. I want to see it too. We want to know what RJ Palacio will write next.

Many schools are using it as a starting point for discussions about bullying, friendship and what it's like to be different. A film version is being made, and many, including me, are waiting eagerly to see what RJ Palacio writes next.
simplified: "Wonder" is the first novel by RJ Palacio, who lives in New York. On her website, she explains that the idea for the book came to her after seeing a girl with a face that looked different on the street one day. Wonder has been a **bestseller** (a very popular book that sells a lot) in the United States and has already won many awards. Many schools are now using it as a starting point for **discussions** (talks) about **bullying** (being unkind to others), **friendship** (being good friends), and what it's like to be different. A film **version** (a film) of the book is being made, and many, including me, are waiting with excitement to see what RJ Palacio writes next.

original: Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. Chloe knows they're not typical pets and she has lost count of the times she's patiently tried to explain to people that rats aren't dirty and they make fantastic pets if you look after them correctly. But she understands why people react badly. She didn't like rats either until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats and she saw how affectionate and intelligent they were. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she'd like to have two of them.
simplified:
Chloe has two pet rats. Their names are Zena and Roxy.
Chloe knows they are not normal pets. She tried many times to tell people. She said rats are not dirty. She said they are good pets. You must look after them well.
But she knows why people feel bad about rats. Chloe did not like rats before. Her friend Martin had pet rats. He showed them to Chloe. Chloe saw they were friendly. She saw they were clever.
Last year, Martin's rat had babies. Chloe wanted two of the babies.

Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she'd like to have two of them.

original: Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons. Some have been injured or killed in car accidents and others have been electrocuted as they played with electric cables. Baboons are an endangered species and to save them and minimise conflicts between humans and baboons, the city council has employed a team of Baboon Monitors. The monitors' job is to chase baboons out of urban areas or catch them and release them in the countryside. This policy has had some success, though it is proving hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city once they see it as a source of easy food.
simplified: Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons. Cars hurt or kill some baboons. Others play with electric cables. The cables can kill them. Baboons are an endangered type of animal. This shows there are not many of these animals left. People want to save them. They also want to make problems between baboons and people smaller. So, the city leaders give jobs to a team of Baboon Monitors. These monitors make baboons leave city areas. Or they catch them and let them go in the countryside. This plan helps a little. But it is hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city. They come back because they find easy food there.

This policy has had some success, though it is proving hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city once they see it as a source of easy food.

The monitors' job is to chase baboons out of city areas, or they catch them and let them go in the countryside. This plan has had some success, but it is still hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city, because they see it as a place for easy food.

original: I work for a global IT company, but because their headquarters is in the States, I do all my work online from home. That means that I don't waste time commuting or making idle chit-chat with colleagues. I work on a project basis, and this flexibility is very valuable to me because it means that I can easily take some time off when my children need me to go to their school performances or if I need to schedule an appointment with the dentist. The downside is that without clear office hours, I tend to work well into the evening, sometimes skipping dinner to finish a task.
simplified:
I work for an IT company in many countries. Its main office is in the USA. So I work from home and online. I do not travel to work. I do not make small talk with other workers.

I work on specific jobs. These jobs have a start and an end. I can change my work schedule easily. This is very important for me. I can take time off easily. My children need me for school shows. I can take time off for them. I can also see the dentist.

But there is a bad thing. I do not have set work times. So I often work late at night. Sometimes I do not eat dinner because I want to finish my work.

I work on a project basis, and this flexibility is very valuable to me because it means that I can easily take some time off when my children need me to go to their school performances or if I need to schedule an appointment with the dentist. The downside is that without clear office hours, I tend to work well into the evening, sometimes skipping dinner to finish a task.
simplified: I work for an international IT company, but because its main office is in the USA, I do all my work online from home. This means I don't lose time travelling to work or having unimportant talks with colleagues. I work on a project system, and this freedom is very important to me. It means I can easily take time off when my children need me to go to their school performances or if I need to arrange a meeting with the dentist. However, there is a problem: because I don't have fixed office hours, I often work late into the evening, sometimes missing dinner to finish a job.

original: In the 1990s, graffiti continued but there was also an explosion in street art around the world. Some artists wanted to make political points and produced art that tried to make people think about war, inequality and discrimination. Other street artists were more concerned with producing beautiful, attractive work. In South America, many street artists went to work in poor areas adding colour, life and beauty to grey, city walls.
simplified:
In the 1990s, graffiti was still popular. (Graffiti is writing or drawings on walls in public places.) Street art also grew very fast around the world. (Street art is art made in public places, like on walls or buildings.)

Some artists made art about how countries are run. They wanted people to think about war. They wanted people to think about when people do not have the same things. They wanted people to think about when people are treated unfairly.

Other street artists wanted to make beautiful art. Their art was nice to look at.

In South America, many artists went to poor areas. They added colour, life, and things that look nice to grey city walls.

original: In the 1990s, graffiti continued but there was also an explosion in street art around the world. Other street artists were more concerned with producing beautiful, attractive work. In South America, many street artists went to work in poor areas adding colour, life and beauty to grey, city walls.
simplified: In the 1990s, graffiti continued, but there was also a big increase in **street art**, which is art made in public places like walls. Some artists wanted to make art with a political message, which made people think about war and how some people are treated unfairly. However, other street artists were more interested in making beautiful and attractive work. For example, in South America, many street artists went to work in poor areas, where they added colour, life, and beautiful things to grey city walls.

original: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people daily with things to buy, and British consumers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping means it is easy for customers to buy without thinking, while major brands offer such cheap clothes that they can be treated like disposable items – worn two or three times and then thrown away.
simplified: Social media, magazines, and shops show people many things. They show things to buy every day. British people buy many clothes and shoes now. Online shopping makes it easy to buy. People buy things fast. Big shops sell very cheap clothes. People wear these clothes two or three times. Then they throw them away. These clothes are like things for throwing away.

original: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people daily with things to buy, and British consumers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping means it is easy for customers to buy without thinking, while major brands offer such cheap clothes that they can be treated like disposable items – worn two or three times and then thrown away.
simplified: Social media, magazines, and shop windows show people many things to buy every day, which means that British people are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping makes it easy for people to buy without thinking carefully. Also, big companies sell clothes that are so cheap that people often treat them like items to throw away. This means they wear these clothes only two or three times and then throw them away.

original: Sam squinted against the sun at the distant dust trail raked up by the car on its way up to the Big House. The horses kicked and flicked their tails at flies, not caring about their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter didn't come out here unless he had to, which was just fine by Sam. The more he kept out of his boss's way, the longer he'd have a job. Mr, Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck. The damp patches on his shirt drew together like shapes in an atlas. His skin was already turning ruddy in the June sun. Otherwise he had the indoor tan of a man that made money while other people did the work.
simplified:
Sam closed his eyes a little because of the sun.
He saw a car far away.
The car made a dust trail. The dust went up.
The car went to the Big House.
The horses kicked. They hit flies with their tails.
They did not care about their owner's visit.
Their owner was coming. He did not visit for ten months.
Sam waited.
Mr. Carter was Sam's boss. He did not come here often.
He came only if he needed to.
Sam liked this.
Sam stayed away from his boss. This way, he could keep his job.
Mr. Carter wiped sweat from his neck.
His shirt was wet.
The wet areas looked like shapes on a map.
His skin became red. The sun in June made it red.
His skin was not dark from the sun. It showed he stayed inside.
He got money. Other people did the work for him.

original: Sam squinted against the sun at the distant dust trail raked up by the car on its way up to the Big House. The horses kicked and flicked their tails at flies, not caring about their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter didn't come out here unless he had to, which was just fine by Sam. The more he kept out of his boss's way, the longer he'd have a job. Mr, Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck. The damp patches on his shirt drew together like shapes in an atlas. His skin was already turning ruddy in the June sun. Otherwise he had the indoor tan of a man that made money while other people did the work.
simplified: Sam closed his eyes a little because of the sun and saw a line of dust far away, which a car was making as it drove up to the Big House. The horses kicked and moved their tails to get rid of flies, but they did not care that their owner was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited because Mr. Carter only came to this place if he had to, and this was good for Sam. He knew that if he stayed away from his boss, he would keep his job longer. Mr. Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck, and the wet parts on his shirt looked like strange shapes as his skin already started to get red in the June sun. However, his skin was not dark from the sun, which showed that he earned money while other people did the work.

original: Many city residents in Berlin, Germany complained that shooting pigs was unnecessarily cruel and there were heated arguments between hunters and animal lovers. In response to protests, the city council decided to take more peaceful action against pigs. Instead of shooting them, they have put up fences and made it illegal to feed the pigs. Time will tell if this strategy works, though it may be a losing battle as warmer winters mean that pig numbers are greater than in the past.
simplified:
Many city residents in Berlin, Germany, were angry. They said shooting pigs was too cruel. It was not needed. Hunters and animal lovers had many angry arguments.

Because of these protests, the city council made a new plan. They wanted a more peaceful way to stop the pigs. They do not shoot the pigs now. They built fences. It is not allowed to feed the pigs.

We will see if this plan works. But it may be a fight they cannot win. Warmer winters mean there are many more pigs than before.

Time will tell if this strategy works, though it may be a losing battle as warmer winters mean that pig numbers are greater than in the past.
simplified: Many city residents in Berlin, Germany, complained that killing pigs was too cruel and not necessary, and there were heated arguments between hunters and animal lovers. In response to these protests, the city leaders decided to take more peaceful action against the pigs. So, instead of killing them, they have put up fences and made it illegal to feed the pigs. We do not know if this plan will work. It might be a difficult fight because warmer winters mean there are more pigs than before.

original: An important inspiration for the Hunger Games book comes from Suzanne's love of classical Greek mythology. When she was a child, one of her favourite stories was Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story the city of Athens is ruled by Crete, but the Athenians rebel. As a punishment, Minos the king of Crete forces the Athenians to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. The youths are thrown into the labyrinth and eaten by a monster that lives there called the Minotaur. But one of the youths, named Theseus, fights the Minotaur and kills it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a futuristic Theseus.
simplified:
Suzanne Collins loves old Greek stories. These stories are called Greek myths. They gave her an important idea for her book, 'The Hunger Games'.
When she was a child, she liked one story very much. It was 'Theseus and the Minotaur'.
In this story, Crete ruled the city of Athens. But the people of Athens rebelled.
Minos was the king of Crete. To punish them, Minos forced Athens to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year.
Minos threw these young people into a labyrinth. A monster called the Minotaur lived there. It ate the young people.
But one young person fought the Minotaur. His name was Theseus. He killed it.
Suzanne thinks Katniss Everdeen is like Theseus in the future.

original: By bringing people and animals together, zoos have the potential to educate the public about conservation issues and inspire people to protect animals and their habitats. Some zoos provide a safe environment for animals which have been mistreated in circuses, or pets which have been abandoned. Zoos also carry out important research into subjects like animal behaviour and how to treat illnesses.
simplified: Zoos bring people and animals together. They can teach people about saving animals and nature. They can make people want to protect animals and their homes. Some zoos give a safe place to animals. These animals were hurt in circuses. Or people left their pets alone. Zoos also do important studies. For example, they study how animals act. They also study how to help sick animals.

original: A different trend is springing up in opposition to consumerism – the 'buy nothing' trend. The idea originated in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US, where it became a rejection of the overspending and overconsumption of Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day people organise various types of protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups organise the exchange and repair of items they already own.
simplified:
A new idea is starting. It is called 'buy nothing'. This idea fights against consumerism. Consumerism is when people buy too many things.
It started in Canada in the early 1990s. Then it went to the US.
In the US, people said 'no' to buying too much. They said 'no' to using too much money. This was on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. These days are after Thanksgiving.
On Buy Nothing Day, people make different protests. They cut their credit cards.
All year, Buy Nothing groups organise swapping things. They also organise fixing things. These are things people already have.

original: A different trend is springing up in opposition to consumerism – the 'buy nothing' trend. The idea originated in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US, where it became a rejection of the overspending and overconsumption of Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day people organise various types of protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups organise the exchange and repair of items they already own.
simplified: A new trend, called 'buy nothing', is starting. It is against **consumerism**, which is the idea that buying and owning many things is good. This idea started in Canada in the early 1990s, and then it moved to the US. In the US, people did not want to spend too much money or buy too many things. This was especially true during Black Friday and Cyber Monday, which are big sales days after Thanksgiving. On Buy Nothing Day, people plan different kinds of protests, and some even cut their credit cards. Also, all through the year, Buy Nothing groups arrange for people to exchange and fix things they already own.

original: Is graffiti art or vandalism? This depends on your point of view, but in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is considered vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police and some have had to pay fines. Many city councils complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti off buildings, buses and trains.
simplified: Is graffiti art or vandalism? People have different ideas. In many countries, people write or paint on public places. They also paint on other people's things. This is vandalism. Police stop many street artists. Some artists must pay fines. City councils complain about the high cost. They clean graffiti off buildings, buses, and trains.

original: Is graffiti art or vandalism? This depends on your point of view, but in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is considered vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police and some have had to pay fines. Many city councils complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti off buildings, buses and trains.
simplified: Graffiti, which is writing or drawing on walls or other public places, can be seen as art or vandalism, and this depends on your point of view. However, in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is considered vandalism. Because of this, many street artists have been stopped by the police and some have had to pay fines. City councils also complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

original: What does the art world think of graffiti and street art? Recently, there has been a growing recognition of its value as an art form. There have been major exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London and Los Angeles. The American artist Elura Emerald organised a street art exhibition at a New York gallery in 2008. She defended street artists, saying 'artists who paint on the street are merely expressing themselves, not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated and celebrated'.
simplified: What do people in art think about graffiti and street art? Now, art people see this art as real art. They think it is important. There were big shows of street art. They were in art places in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. Elura Emerald is an art person from America. She made a street art show in 2008. It was in a New York art place. She spoke for street art people. She said: "Art people paint on the street. They just show their feelings. They do not hurt anyone. People should like them. People should praise them."

She defended street artists, saying 'artists who paint on the street are merely expressing themselves, not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated and celebrated'.
simplified: People in the art world have started to think differently about `graffiti`, which is writing or drawings on walls in public places, and `street art`, which is art made in public places. She defended street artists, saying that artists who paint on the street are `just` expressing `their own feelings` and not hurting anyone. She believed that people should `like` and `celebrate` them.

original: If most people have four to six dreams every night after the age of ten, that's as many as 2,000 dreams per year. So, by the time they reach 80 years old the average person might have had 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget 95–99 per cent of our dreams, that's still a few thousand remembered dreams across a lifetime. It's not too difficult to believe that, by coincidence, a dream event is followed by a real-life event that's similar to it, especially if the subject of the dream is something that happens often in everyday life.
simplified:
Most people have four to six dreams every night. This starts after they are ten years old. That is 2,000 dreams a year. When people get to 80 years old, they can have 140,000 dreams.

We forget most dreams. We forget 95 to 99 dreams out of 100. But we still remember many dreams in our life.

It is easy to think that a dream can be like a real event. This happens by chance. It is mostly true if the dream is about normal things. These things happen often in daily life.

There used to be a thirteenth district, but it rebelled against the Capitol in the past and was destroyed.

original: George Lucas was one of the early film directors to directly base his story on the 17 stages of the hero's journey. Typically the hero starts the story living an ordinary life, but something happens that calls them to an adventure that changes everything. At the beginning of Star Wars, Luke lives an ordinary life with his aunt and uncle, repairing robots. When he finds Princess Leia's message to Obi-Wan Kenobi inside the robot R2D2, it is 'the call to adventure' that starts the hero on his journey.
simplified:
George Lucas made films. He used a special story idea. It is called "the hero's journey." This idea has 17 steps. George Lucas used these steps for his stories.

Usually, a hero lives a normal life. But then something happens. It tells them to go on an adventure. This adventure makes everything different.

First, in Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life. He lives with his aunt and uncle. He fixes robots.

He finds a message. It is from Princess Leia. It is for Obi-Wan Kenobi. It is in the robot R2D2. This message is the call to adventure. It starts his trip.

For example, at the beginning of Star Wars, Luke lives an ordinary life with his aunt and uncle, and he repairs robots. However, when he finds Princess Leia's message to Obi-Wan Kenobi inside the robot R2D2, this is 'the call to adventure' that starts him on his journey.

original: Another suggested defence against a PHA on course to hit Earth is to blow it up using a nuclear weapon. It may sound like a plot from a film, and it was the subject of the 1998 film Armageddon, but the Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response (HAMMER) is a genuine NASA proposal. The eight-ton rockets would be fired at an approaching asteroid with the hope of bumping it off course. If the asteroid was too close to Earth for this plan to work, the rockets would carry nuclear bombs to blow it up instead.
simplified:
Sometimes, big rocks in space can hit Earth. These rocks are called PHAs.
NASA has an idea to keep Earth safe. One idea is to blow up a PHA.
This idea sounds like a movie story. The movie 'Armageddon' in 1998 was about this.
But it is a real plan from NASA. It is called HAMMER.
HAMMER means 'Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response'.
HAMMER uses big rockets. These rockets are very heavy, eight tons.
NASA can fire these rockets at a PHA. The PHA is coming near Earth.
They hope to push it off its path. This moves it away from Earth.
But if the PHA is too close to Earth. This plan will not work then.
Then, the rockets will carry nuclear bombs. These bombs will make the PHA break into many pieces.

original: Another suggested defence against a PHA on course to hit Earth is to blow it up using a nuclear weapon. It may sound like a plot from a film, and it was the subject of the 1998 film Armageddon, but the Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response (HAMMER) is a genuine NASA proposal. The eight-ton rockets would be fired at an approaching asteroid with the hope of bumping it off course. If the asteroid was too close to Earth for this plan to work, the rockets would carry nuclear bombs to blow it up instead.
simplified: An **asteroid** is a rock that flies through space. One way to protect Earth from an asteroid is to make it explode with a nuclear bomb. This idea might seem like a story from a film, and it was even in the 1998 film 'Armageddon'. However, NASA has a real plan for this. It is called HAMMER. HAMMER is a NASA plan to deal with asteroids in an emergency. This plan uses eight-ton rockets, which would be sent towards an asteroid that is coming closer. The hope is that these rockets would push the asteroid and change its direction. But if the asteroid is too close to Earth, this plan would not work. In that case, the rockets would instead carry nuclear bombs to make it explode.

original: Underutilised items may seem useless to some, but could be an asset to others. With the advent of the internet, online communities have figured out a way to generate profit from the sharing of those underused assets. Using websites and social media groups that facilitate the buying and selling of second-hand goods, it is now easier than ever for peer-to-peer sharing activities to take place. And this is known as the sharing economy.
simplified: A 'sharing economy' is a system. People share things they do not use much. These things may seem useless to some. But they can be valuable for others. People make money from sharing these things. The internet helps with this. Online groups now find ways to make money from these underused things. They use websites and social media groups. These help people buy and sell things that are not new. It is now easy to share things directly. People share with other people. This is the 'sharing economy'.

original: Around the 18th and 19th centuries two main ideas about dreams became popular. One was the idea that the things we see in our dreams represent things hidden from our conscious mind. Freud believed that if we understand what dreams are telling us, we can understand our hidden feelings and the problems they cause. However, the other theory was the opposite. It said that dreams are just a collection of random activity in the brain while it's organising memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings and put them into some sort of story.
simplified:
About 200 years ago, two big ideas about dreams were popular.
One idea was this: Dreams show us things we do not know. We do not know these things when we are awake. Freud was a famous doctor. He thought this: If we know what dreams mean, we can know our feelings. These are feelings inside us. We can also know our problems.

But the other idea was the opposite. It said dreams are just mixed up things in our brain. Our brain does this when it puts memories from the day in order. When we wake up, we try to understand these mixed up pictures and feelings. We try to make them into a story.

Freud believed that if we understand what dreams are telling us, we can understand our hidden feelings and the problems they cause. However, the other theory was the opposite. It said that dreams are just a collection of random activity in the brain while it's organising memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings and put them into some sort of story.
simplified: In the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that the things we see in our dreams show us things that are hidden in our minds. Freud believed that if we understand what our dreams are telling us, we can understand our secret feelings and the problems they cause. However, the other idea was completely different. It said that dreams are just a mix of random things happening in the brain while it is organizing memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to understand these random pictures and feelings, and we put them into some kind of story.

original: I'm a freelancer and work for myself. This is great because I am in control of what I do and how I spend my time. At first, I was working from home, but I found it really hard to concentrate. There were just too many distractions around: housework that needed doing, another cup of tea, my family members wanting my attention for various things. So I started to go to a nearby café to work, but the Wi-Fi connection wasn't ideal and I found myself drinking too much coffee. In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space with five other freelancers like myself. I liked getting dressed to go to work in the morning and being able to focus in an office environment.
simplified:
A freelancer works for different people. They are their own boss.

So I went to a cafe near my home. I worked there. But the internet was not very good. I drank too much coffee.

A co-working space is a place. Many people work there. They share desks.
In the end, I paid to use a desk. It was in a co-working space. Five other freelancers worked there too. I liked to put on clothes for work. I liked to go to work in the morning. I could focus on my work there. It felt like a real office.

original: Religion is important to Pi. Though his family is Hindu, he is curious about other religions and he makes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. From that moment, his family and teachers decide to let him make his own mind up about religion.

original: Some people think writing your dreams down can open your mind to lucid dreaming. Lucid dreams are dreams where you're not only aware you're dreaming but you can make decisions to affect the events of your dreams. So, maybe you can turn a nightmare into a safe-feeling dream, or you can direct the plot of your dream like a film director. Then, instead of just working out the meaning of your dreams, you'll be creating them, though you might want to continue having some dreams that allow your subconscious to tell you what's on your mind!
simplified:
Some people write their dreams. This can help them have lucid dreams.
What are lucid dreams? They are dreams where you know you are dreaming. You can change what happens in them.
So, you can change a bad dream. You can make it a good dream. You can also control the dream's story. You are like a film director.
Then, you do not just understand your dreams. You make them. But maybe you want to keep some dreams. These dreams let your brain tell you things.

original: People might not realise they are part of the disposable clothing problem because they donate their unwanted clothes to charities. But charity shops can't sell all those unwanted clothes. 'Fast fashion' goes out of fashion as quickly as it came in and is often too poor quality to recycle; people don't want to buy it second-hand. Huge quantities end up being thrown away, and a lot of clothes that charities can't sell are sent abroad, causing even more economic and environmental problems.
simplified:
"Fast fashion" means clothes become popular quickly. They are popular for a short time.
There is a 'disposable clothing problem'. This means people throw away many clothes. People do not know they are part of this problem. They give their old clothes to charity shops. But charity shops cannot sell all these clothes.
Fast fashion clothes are often bad quality. People cannot recycle them. This means people cannot make new things from them. People do not want to buy them second-hand. Many clothes are thrown away. Charity shops send many clothes they cannot sell to other countries. This causes more money problems and problems for nature.

Huge quantities end up being thrown away, and a lot of clothes that charities can't sell are sent abroad, causing even more economic and environmental problems.

Because of this, people do not want to buy these clothes second-hand. So, huge amounts of clothes finally go into the rubbish. Also, many clothes that charity shops cannot sell are sent to other countries, and this creates even more money and nature problems.

original: Not content with one amazing trip, some of today's adventurers go from challenge to challenge. Many of us would have given up at that point, but Meagan decided to carry on. original: Having decided to go to school, Auggie then has to face his first day. Like every child starting at a new school, he is really anxious. But because of the way he looks, it's an agonising experience. Nobody wants to sit next to him and he notices other kids staring at him or talking about him behind their hands. Fortunately, he makes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he chats with at lunch. But it's not just the first day that's hard. Auggie soon learns that his classmates don't want to touch him for fear of catching 'the plague'. As he goes through the school year, Auggie goes through many intense ups and downs till finally an unexpected and traumatic event at a school camp changes things completely.
simplified:
Auggie goes to school. It is his first day. He feels very worried. All children feel worried at a new school. But Auggie looks different. So this time is very hard for him.

Other children do not want to sit near him. They look at him. They talk about him behind their hands. Luckily, he makes two friends. Jack is a boy in his class. Summer is a girl he talks to at lunch.

But the first day is not the only hard day. Soon, Auggie learns something. His classmates do not want to touch him. They are afraid of 'the plague'.

Auggie stays at school all year. He has many good times and many very, very hard times. Then, a very bad and surprising thing happens at a school camp. It is a very, very hard time for Auggie. Nobody expects it. It changes everything very much.

After Auggie decided to go to school, he had to face his first day. Like every child starting a new school, he felt anxious, but because of how he looks, it was an extremely difficult experience for him. Nobody wanted to sit next to him, and he noticed other children staring at him or whispering about him. Fortunately, he made friends with Jack, who was a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he chats with at lunch.

But the first day was not the only hard part. Auggie quickly found out that his classmates did not want to touch him because they were afraid of catching 'the plague'. During the school year, Auggie experienced many ups and downs. Then, an unexpected and disturbing event happened at a school camp, which changed everything completely.

original: The two men looked towards the northern end of the property. It stretched as far as the eye could see. Even the fences were barely visible from where they stood. However bored and rebellious a teenage boy might get, it wasn't possible to escape on foot. Sam looked at the biggest of the horses, kicking at the ground with its heavy hooves. Could the boy ride? he wondered. There was a whole load of trouble a good rider could get into out here, miles away from anyone. But maybe there was even more trouble for someone who knew nothing about horses and wanted to get away from his father.
simplified:
Two men looked to the north. They looked at the land. The land went on and on. They could not see its end. The fences were very far. They were hard to see. A teenage boy might be bored. He might be rebellious. But he could not get away on foot.

Sam looked at the biggest horse. It kicked the ground. Its hooves were heavy. He thought: "Can the boy ride?" A good rider could find a lot of trouble here. It was many miles from anyone. But maybe a boy who did not know horses could find even more trouble. He wanted to run away from his father.

original: If we look around us at the things we have purchased at some point in our lives, we would no doubt notice that not everything we own is being put to good use: the thick woollen coat which we thought looked trendy despite the fact that we live in a tropical country, the smartphone that got put away when we bought ourselves the newest model, the car that only gets used at the weekends, or even the guest room in our house that somehow got turned into a storeroom.
simplified:
Think about the things we buy.
We buy many things in our lives.
But not all things we own are used well.
For example, we buy a thick woollen coat.
We thought it looked trendy.
But we live in a tropical country.
We do not use the coat.
We also buy a smartphone.
Then we buy the newest model.
We put the old phone away.
We have a car.
We only use the car on weekends.
We have a guest room in our house.
It turned into a storeroom.

original: Throughout history and across cultures, dreams have been associated with prophecy. People thought dreams were messages from the gods, sent to give us knowledge or insight. These messages gave them information. They helped people understand things. Even today, many people remember dreams. They dreamed about a thing, a place, or a person. Later, this dream happened for real.

original: Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation projects in the world have involved building bridges. Bridges are crucial links that carry cars, trucks and trains across bodies of water, mountain gorges or other roads. As a result, they are one of the most important aspects of civil engineering and are subject to intense scrutiny, especially when they collapse.
simplified:
Building bridges is one of the biggest and most expensive transport projects in the world.
Bridges are very important links. They carry cars, trucks, and trains.
They go across water. They go over deep, narrow valleys in mountains. They also go over other roads.
So, bridges are a very important part of the work of building things. This work is about thinking about and building roads, buildings, and bridges.
People check bridges very carefully. They do this especially when a bridge falls down.

As a result, they are a key part of `civil engineering`, which is the job of designing and building roads, bridges, and other public structures. People check them very carefully, especially when they fall down.

original: Dogs that live in packs have learnt that humans are more likely to give food to smaller, cuter dogs so those dogs are sent to beg for food for the whole pack. Some dogs have even learnt to use the city's metro system to get from one part of their territory to another! Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their excellent sense of smell and have learnt to recognise the scents of their favourite destinations. Another possibility is that they have learnt to recognise the names of stations they hear in announcements. Either way, metro passengers have now got so used to the sight of dogs on the trains that they travel largely unnoticed by locals.
simplified:
Dogs live in groups. They learn that people give food to small, cute dogs more. So, the group sends these dogs to beg for food for everyone.
It is surprising. Some dogs learn to use the city's metro system. They go from one area to another area. Scientists do not know how dogs get off the train at the right time.
One idea is this: Dogs have a very, very good sense of smell. They learn to recognise the special smells of their favourite places. Another idea is this: Maybe they learn to recognise station names. They hear these names in train announcements.
People on the metro see dogs often now. They are very used to seeing them. So, locals do not notice the dogs.

Some dogs have even learned to use the city's metro system to go from one area to another. Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their very good sense of smell, and they have learned to know the smells of their favourite places. Another idea is that they have learned to know the names of stations which they hear in announcements. In any case, people who use the metro have now become so used to seeing dogs on the trains that local people mostly do not notice them.

original: Ed Stafford from the UK is the first person to walk the length of the Amazon River. He started by a small stream in the Andes mountains of Peru and arrived at the river's mouth in Brazil, two years and four months later, having walked 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon rainforest is home to poisonous snakes, crocodiles and jaguars, so Ed was in constant danger. Luckily, he survived with nothing worse than a few thousand mosquito and ant bites.
simplified:
Ed Stafford is from the UK.
He was the first person.
He walked all of the Amazon River.
He started at a very small river in Peru.
This was in the Andes mountains.
He walked to the mouth of the river in Brazil.
He walked for two years and four months.
He walked 6,000 kilometres.

The Amazon has a big forest with much rain.
There are snakes that can kill you.
There are also crocodiles and jaguars.
So, Ed was always in danger.
He was lucky.
The bites from mosquitoes and ants were the only bad things that happened.
He did not get hurt by the big animals.

simplified: Ed Stafford, who is from the UK, was the first person to walk the whole length of the Amazon River. The Amazon rainforest, which is home to dangerous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars, meant Ed was in constant danger. Fortunately, he survived with nothing worse than a few thousand mosquito and ant bites.

original: In Britain, the average person spends more than £1,000 on new clothes a year, which is around four per cent of their income. That might not sound like much, but that figure hides two far more worrying trends for society and for the environment. First, a lot of that consumer spending is via credit cards. British people currently owe approximately £670 per adult to credit card companies. That's 66 per cent of the average wardrobe budget. Also, not only are people spending money they don't have, they're using it to buy things they don't need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing a year, most of which goes into landfill sites.
simplified:
In Britain, most people buy new clothes. They spend more than £1,000 each year. This is about four per cent of the money they earn. This may not seem like a lot of money. But this number hides two very worrying problems. These problems are bad for people and for nature.

First, people buy many clothes with credit cards. Now, British adults must pay back money. They must pay back about £670 each to companies. This is 66 per cent of the money for clothes each year.

Also, people spend money they do not have. They buy things they do not need with this money. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes each year. Most of these clothes go into the ground with other rubbish.

He used the media interest in his trip to protest about the destruction of the rainforest and raise money for environmental and children's charities in Brazil and Peru.

News people wrote about his trip. Ed took this news. He spoke against destroying the big forest with much rain. He also asked for money. This money was for groups that help nature and children. These groups were in Brazil and Peru.

original: Businesses have caught on to the profitability of the sharing economy and are seeking to gain from making use of those underutilised resources. A business model that has rapidly risen in popularity sees companies providing an online platform that puts customers in contact with those who can provide a particular product or service. Companies like Airbnb act as a middleman for people to cash in on their unused rooms and houses and let them out as lucrative accommodation. Another example is Uber, which encourages people to use their own personal cars as taxis to make some extra cash in their free time.
simplified: Businesses want to make a lot of money. They use things that people do not use enough. This is called the sharing economy. The sharing economy helps people share things and make money. This business idea became popular quickly. Companies give an online platform. This is a website or an app. It connects customers and people. These people can give a product or a service. Airbnb is an example. It acts like a middleman. It connects people who have rooms or houses. It connects them with people who want to stay there. People can earn a lot of money from their unused rooms and houses. They rent these places to other people. Uber is another example. It encourages people to use their own cars like taxis. They can earn extra money in their free time.

Companies like Airbnb act as a middleman for people to cash in on their unused rooms and houses and let them out as lucrative accommodation. Another example is Uber, which encourages people to use their own personal cars as taxis to make some extra cash in their free time.
simplified: Companies have realised that they can make money from the **sharing economy**, which is a system where people share things they own, like cars or houses, with others for money. These companies want to benefit from using things that people don't use all the time. A business model that has become very popular quickly is when companies provide an online platform which connects customers with people who can provide a certain product or service. For example, companies like Airbnb help people make money from their rooms and houses that they don't use, because they can rent them out as places to stay and earn good money. Another example is Uber, which encourages people to use their own cars as taxis to earn some extra money in their free time.

original: One of the most important modern functions of zoos is supporting international breeding programmes, particularly for endangered species. In the wild, some of the rarest species have difficulty in finding mates and breeding, and they might also be threatened by poachers, loss of their habitat and predators. A good zoo will enable these species to live and breed in a secure environment. In addition, as numbers of some wild species drop, there is an increased danger of populations becoming too genetically similar. Breeding programmes provide a safeguard: zoo-bred animals can be released into the wild to increase genetic diversity.
simplified:
A `species` is a group of animals or plants that are the same kind.

Zoos do important work now. They help animals have babies. This is for many countries. It is especially for `species` in danger.

In nature, some `species` are very rare. They cannot find a partner easily. They cannot have babies easily. Also, bad people hunt them. They lose their homes. Other animals hunt them.

A good zoo helps these `species`. They can live there. They can have babies there. It is a safe place.

Also, fewer wild `species` live in nature. So, the animals become too much alike. This is a problem for their family.

Having babies in zoos helps. Animals from zoos can go back to nature. This makes the animal families more different. This is good for them.

In addition, as numbers of some wild species drop, there is an increased danger of populations becoming too genetically similar. Breeding programmes provide a safeguard: zoo-bred animals can be released into the wild to increase genetic diversity.
simplified: Zoos have an important modern job: supporting international breeding programmes, especially for species (kinds of animals) that are in danger of disappearing. In the wild, some of the rarest species (kinds of animals) find it difficult to get partners and have babies. They might also be in danger from poachers, losing their homes, and other animals that hunt them. A good zoo will let these species (kinds of animals) live and have babies in a safe place. In addition, when the number of some wild species (kinds of animals) drops, there is a bigger danger. The animals in these groups can become too similar because they have very similar genes. Breeding programmes give them protection. Animals born in zoos can be put back into the wild, which helps to make the groups have more different genes.

original: Both of these kinds of accidents are extremely rare, but boats and trains can cause a bridge to collapse for different reasons. With trains, it's the velocity of the impact that can bring a bridge down. With boats, it's the very large mass they have that can bring about the collapse, even if they are moving very slowly when it occurs. The best way to avoid bridge failures is to plan for them. Modern technologies that can detect structural weakness, safer working environments and better designs can all help to reduce these terrible accidents.
simplified:
These accidents do not happen very often.
But boats and trains can make a bridge fall down.
They make bridges fall down in different ways.
A bridge can fall down because of a train's speed.
A bridge can fall down because of a boat's big size and heavy weight.
This can happen even if the boat moves slowly.
We can stop bridges from falling down.
We must plan for this.
New technology can find weak places in bridges.
Safe places to work can help.
Good designs can also help.
These things can help to stop terrible accidents.

original: Both of these kinds of accidents are extremely rare, but boats and trains can cause a bridge to collapse for different reasons. With trains, it's the velocity of the impact that can bring a bridge down. With boats, it's the very large mass they have that can bring about the collapse, even if they are moving very slowly when it occurs. The best way to avoid bridge failures is to plan for them. Modern technologies that can detect structural weakness, safer working environments and better designs can all help to reduce these terrible accidents.
simplified: Accidents where a bridge can **collapse**, which means it falls down, are very rare. However, boats and trains can make a bridge fall down for different reasons. When a train hits a bridge, its high speed and the force of the hit can make the bridge fall. But with boats, it is their very large size and weight that can make a bridge fall, even if they are moving very slowly. The best way to stop bridges from falling down is to plan for these problems. Modern technologies can find weak points in the bridge's structure, and this, together with safer working places and better designs, can help to make these bad accidents happen less often.

Some of the animals are sold to zoos in North America and the family travel by ship to Canada taking the animals with them. On the way, there is a terrible storm and the ship sinks. Tragically, Pi's family and the ship's sailors all drown, but Pi finds himself in a lifeboat with a hyena, zebra, orang-utan and an enormous tiger.

However, during the journey, there is a terrible storm, and the ship sinks. Sadly, Pi's family and all the sailors drown, but Pi finds himself in a lifeboat with a hyena, a zebra, an orang-utan, and an enormous tiger.

original: The Hunger Games is a hugely successful book for teenagers and young adults by the American author Suzanne Collins. Since it was published in 2008 it has been translated into 26 different languages and has sold millions of copies around the world. It is also the first book for young readers to sell more than a million electronic copies. The Hunger Games is now a major Hollywood film and is just as successful. It made 152.5 million dollars in its opening weekend in North America alone!
